title: Unblurred
hundred_word_description: Unblurred: First Fridays on Penn is a monthly initiative sponsored by the Penn Avenue Arts Initiative, a joint program of the BGC and Friendship Development Associates. What started as an attempt to revitalize Penn Avenue between Negley and Mathilda has transformed into one of the city's hottest cultural events.

title: Chris Ehrenberger
hundred_word_description:
21+ | ID at the door
Showtime, 9:30PM
Presenting Katie Zeak & Chris Ehrenberger from one of Pittsburgh's favorite local bands, Juniper Six. Join us for a special intimate performance from this amazing duo, who will be bringing us an entire evening of folk meets rock: stunning vocals, acoustics, and good times. We'll have our doors open all day. Enjoy a cocktail during Happy Hour Hangout ($1 off Signature Cocktails, 1/2 off Seasonal Bottles, and $1 off Domestic Bottles from 7pm-9pm), have a bite to eat and check out some of our local art and featured musicians.
cover_charge: Free - This one is on us!

title: David Strait - Oil Paintings
hundred_word_description:
David Strait - Oil Paintings of Traditional Landscapes and Subjects. Live music by Ryan Neitznick. 
Bathroom is not open to the public.

title: Power(ed) by Grace
hundred_word_description:
Power(ed) by Grace
Refreshments by Rock Bottom 21+ with ID while supplies last.
Music by Grand Snafu
6pm-10pm FREE

Power(ed) by Grace is a multimedia project dedicated to documenting black womanhood in Pittsburgh. Originally launched in Fall, 2015, The Sankofa Series marks an expansion of the project. The Sankofa principle symbolizes bringing the past into the present—that in order to move forward, we must first look back. In this photoessay, historic photos will be collected from albums belonging to families across Pittsburgh. Paired with similarly themed contemporary candid photos, the goal of the work is to spark a conversation about the evolution of black womanhood in Pittsburgh, and consequently in the United States in general.

title: Cardboard Spaceships by Ryder Henry
venue_name: Stuff n Such Society: Installation Gallery
hundred_word_description:
Cardboard Spaceships by Ryder Henry

During  the cold winter night, there is nothing that so warms the soul as the quiet contemplation of spacelight emanating  from a cardboard shell. The warm heart of electric artifice is cozy and safe.  I'm ignorant of the true source of that warmth.  Must be that stinky power plant out there somewhere. I'd sort of like to know, but they don't give tours.  And I have more trivial concerns, like cardboard spaceships.

title: Drawing in Light
hundred_word_description: Light is something that surrounds us as we go about our everyday lives. It’s almost a forgotten element until we realize that it is integral to how we go about our lives in an ever more technologically driven world. This month, the American Jewish Museum has partnered with artist Lori Hepner to create a series of interactive workshops that take advantage of the neon of the now, LEDs, to draw with light in unexpected ways. Taking inspiration from the light based work in the AJM’s Jane Haskell: Drawing in Light retrospective and Lori Hepner has devised a series of pieces to allow the public to help craft an exhibition at Assemble that will evolve over the course of a month.

title: Pittsburgh Activism: A Retrospective
hundred_word_description: Pittsburgh Activism: A Retrospective- Mixed media gallery of PIttsburgh's rich activist history from the 70's to present.  Come check out  pictures, swap stories and enjoy some wine.

title: Lifeforms 2016
hundred_word_description: After a stunning and successful first run of Lifeforms in 2013, we're doing it again. "Lifeforms 2016" will be an exhibition of the best biological glass models made in the spirit of the famous 19th and 20th century models of invertebrates and plants made by the father and son team, Rudolf and Leopold Blaschka for the Harvard University’s Botanical Museum. Free opening reception during Unblurred.

title: Home Style Hot Jam
hundred_word_description:
Home Style Hot Jam
In partnership with Bridgeway Capital’s Craft Business Accelerator, this special open house features hand crafted work for the home. Come and meet local craftspeople who create items specifically for the home such as lighting, hardware and furniture. Watch live demonstrations including glassblowing, ceramics and more.  Free.

title: HOT JAM
hundred_word_description:
HOT JAM
Hot Jam Open House featuring heat defying acts of art in the state-of the-art glass studios. Plus, “Lifeforms”, a juried exhibition of glass biological models.

title: Prairie!
hundred_word_description: Come say “hello” to the newest restaurant on Penn Avenue: Prairie! Offering fresh food from the farm, field, and stream, alongside delightful drinks and desserts in an easy-breezy atmosphere. Plus view some fantastic new artwork installations by Gabe Felice and Jason Sauer. Dinner 5-11pm,

title: VALENTINE
hundred_word_description: This is the place to find your VALENTINE GIFT!  Robin's Nest has a wide selection of unique jewelry, chocolates, wall art, pottery, woodwork, art glass and more.  Register for our monthly Unblurred giveaway!

title: Join us for Hot Jam
hundred_word_description: Join us for Hot Jam, a free open house featuring heat defying acts of art including live glassblowing demonstrations and a contemporary glass art exhibition. Fun for the entire family.
categories: Performance, Visual Art, Art (Other), Unblurred, Kid/Family Friendly

title: Spork
hundred_word_description: Join us for delicious cocktails and small plates!

title: Dance the night away
hundred_word_description:
Dance the night away as KST transforms its lobby into a Jamaican dance hall filled with your favorite new and old-school Reggae tunes, special performances, treats and more!

Featuring a special concert byAfar Music Group's Oriel & The Revolutors + Jah Ques ft. Clara! 

Food Truck Spotlight: Curbside Twist

title: Utterances
hundred_word_description:
Utterances: New works by Jay Michael Del Greco


Artist Statement
My new series is called Utterances, because I wanted to produce a series of small, tight pieces that each succinctly evoke a unique thought or emotional state. They are all uniform 1 foot squares with strong iconic compositions.

In a broader context my work's purpose is always to give shape to shapeless things; namely time, weight, heat, and distress. To that end, I draw inspiration from my own life, obfuscating away mundane details that would make the work too specifically about me and my frame of reference. It’s important to me that my work is accessible and able to mean whatever a viewer needs it to mean to them. With each new piece I aim to create the most beautiful thing that I can, and express myself entirely with it.

From a technical standpoint, I work with a very broad vocabulary of materials. Each piece is very sculptural mixed media, generally on wood, involving any combination found animal parts, house paint, spray paint, polyurethane, epoxy resin, burnt wood, various found rusted metal objects, twine, string, wire, cloth, vinyl, permanent marker, and charcoal illustration.
categories: Visual Art, Art (Other), Unblurred, Kid/Family Friendly, Pet Friendly

title: Diana Balderson
hundred_word_description: Los Sabrosos Dance Co. is excited to host a new artist in the studio. Diana Balderson's work interprets portraiture through vivid imagery and contrast, experiencing every day circumstances and creating new images from those puzzle pieces. There is a disconnect within her artwork - the feeling of being alone in a sea of people, both a comfort and a feeling of tension within the same atmosphere.
categories: Dance, Visual Art, Art (Other), Unblurred, Kid/Family Friendly, Pet Friendly

title: Get your hands dirty
hundred_word_description: Stop in and get your hands dirty at our enchanting home & garden shop! We'll have a DIY terrarium station set up and lots of beautiful plants and terrariums available for purchase. We've got a nice stock of candles from North Ave Candles and beautiful doTerra oils to sample as well. Stop in and get amped for spring!

title: Prison Poster Project
hundred_word_description:
The exhibit will showcase artists from both sides of the prison walls including  Mary Dewitt's profoundly moving portraits of women serving life in PA.  Illustrations describing prison conditions and self portraits by incarcerated artists from The Prison Poster Project (PPP) will also be displayed. The PPP was a collaboration between artists across the razor wire to create a teaching tool about the prison industrial complex. 

At 7pm on Friday April 7th there will be speakers and songs including family members of people serving life, survivors of violence who support the campaign, readings from the writings of those sentenced to life as juveniles, and information on the Campaign to End Death by Incarceration.
categories: Lecture, Visual Art, Workshop/Class, Art (Other), Unblurred, Kid/Family Friendly

title: Loryn Bertoti
hundred_word_description: Loryn Bertoti, a mixed-media artist with a background in engineering and fabrication, is Assemble's April Unblurred artist. Loryn's exhibition for the April show will be a large tessellating pattern of two main elements. The first is laser cut wood, and the second is hand-made aluminum can flowers. The overall theme is springtime, and a celebration of the new beauty that is soon to emerge in nature – flowers, vibrant colors, bees, etc. Most of the material used in this piece, as well as my previous work, will be recycled. The wooden pieces in the tessellation will be intricately cut and illuminated to mimic the bright colors and patterns found in nature. The mixture of the two materials organic and inorganic (wood and aluminum), is Loryn's favorite way to simplify and represent the beauty in the world around us.
categories: Food, Visual Art, Art (Other), Unblurred, Kid/Family Friendly, Pet Friendly, crafts

title: A listening of Kendrick Lamar
hundred_word_description:
We are at it again at Level Up with another amazing night of art, music and of course dancing!! As part of Penn Ave's Unblurred Gallery Crawl, join us April 7th from 6pm-12am for a listening of Kendrick Lamar's anticipated album with featured wire artist Julius Houser!! 

About the Artist:
Julius Houser: An Artist who grew up in Pittsburgh PA found his passion in Wire Art between the ages of 7 & 8. It started with not getting the exact toys he wanted, so he created his own toys from his imagination and could fashion anything he laid eyes on; from superheroes, to bridges, buildings and cars. As an artist he's a really big fan of superheroes and villians and spends his time creating pieces inspired by fictional characters and even mystical creatures.

Exhibition 6pm-9pm Showcasing Wire Art by Julius Houser

Listening Party/ Dancing 9pm-12am (byob)
